title: Easy Meatloaf Recipe (with Video)
description: This meatloaf recipe is easy to make and doesn't take long to prep. It's one of our best recipes that's been made over 8,000 times and never disappoints!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Main Dishes Meatloaf Recipes Beef Meatloaf Recipes Easy Meatloaf 4.7 (9,227) 7,062 Reviews 1,037 Photos This meatloaf recipe doesn't take long to make at all, and it's very good! Submitted by Janet Shum Updated on January 30, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 1,037 1,037 1,037 1,037 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 15 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 (9x5-inch) meatloaf Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Get back to basics with this easy meatloaf recipe. It's quick, traditional, delicious, and it's sure to please everyone at your table. How to Make Meatloaf You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Meatloaf Ingredients These are the simple ingredients you'll need to make this homemade meatloaf recipe: · For the loaf: ground beef, an egg, an onion, milk, bread crumbs, salt, and pepper· For the sauce: ketchup, brown sugar, mustard How to Make a Meatloaf at Home Here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make meatloaf from scratch: 1. Mix the loaf ingredients, then transfer to a loaf pan.2. Mix the sauce ingredients, then pour over the loaf.3. Bake in the preheated oven until the meatloaf is no longer pink in the center. How Long to Cook Meatloaf In an oven preheated to 350 degrees F, this classic meatloaf should be fully cooked in about one hour. You'll know it's done when the meat is no longer pink in the center. What Temperature Is Meatloaf Done? Use an instant read thermometer, inserted into the middle, to check the doneness of the meatloaf. It's completely cooked and safe to eat at 160 degrees F. What Goes With Meatloaf? In need of some serving ideas? We've got you covered! Explore our collection of 12 Best Side Dishes for Meatloaf for delicious inspiration. Here's a preview of what you'll find: · The Best Mashed Potatoes· Italian Peas· Roasted Parmesan-Garlic Carrots How to Store and Freeze Meatloaf Tightly wrap the meatloaf in plastic wrap or aluminum foil (or place it in an airtight container). Store meatloaf in the refrigerator for three to four days.To freeze meatloaf, wrap it in at least one layer of storage wrap followed by at least one layer of foil. For extra protection, place the double-wrapped meatloaf in a zip-top freezer bag labeled with the date. Store meatloaf in the freezer for three to four months. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "I've been making this recipe for years," raves Alethea Taylor. "I make mini loaves and it doesn't take as long to cook. I also am able to freeze the leftovers for quick dinners or meatloaf sandwiches." "It was simple and quick," says Simpson. "I loved it. I added green peppers and used honey BBQ sauce instead of ketchup. It turned out great." "Great recipe," raves another Allrecipes community member. "Easy to prepare. The directions are easy to follow and produce a great meatloaf. Wonderful flavor and texture!" Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 ½ pounds ground beef 1 large egg 1 onion, chopped 1 cup milk 1 cup dried bread crumbs salt and pepper to taste ⅓ cup ketchup 2 tablespoons brown sugar 2 tablespoons prepared mustard Directions Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Combine ground beef, onion, milk, bread crumbs, and egg in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper. Transfer into prepared loaf pan. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Mix ketchup, brown sugar, and mustard together in a small bowl until well combined; pour over meatloaf and spread it evenly over the top. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Serve hot and enjoy! Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Cook’s Note You can use crushed crackers in place of bread crumbs if you prefer. I Made It Print 21,257 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 372 Calories 25g Fat 19g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 372 % Daily Value * Total Fat 25g 32% Saturated Fat 10g 50% Cholesterol 98mg 33% Sodium 335mg 15% Total Carbohydrate 19g 7% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 9g Protein 18g 36% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 81mg 6% Iron 2mg 13% Potassium 343mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Meatloaf 01 of 1,037 Photo by  Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco 02 of 1,037 Photo by  Trudy 03/31/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort The recipe was easy to follow and easy to adjust to make it my own. I added Italian dry herbs to the dry mix. I substituted the brown sugar with my favorite barbecue sauce. It was delicious! 03 of 1,037 Photo by  ladyfun 10/15/2024 Browned red bell peppers, mushrooms, and fresh garlic(1/2c fresh total) plus the onions in olive oil. Used Progresso Italian bread crumbs, canned milk, and 1tlb Worcestershire sauce.(1tsp each)Garlic powder, onion powder, McCormic pink Himalayan season salt.Didn't use ketchup, brown sugar or mustard 04 of 1,037 Photo by  Barb 09/01/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite I haven’t made meatloaf in years and I lost my favorite recipe. When I made the sauce, I didn’t have brown sugar so I substituted it with honey and it made the sauce amazing! 05 of 1,037 Photo by  MatureFlour2961 04/13/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort I made this meatloaf on my Traeger grill and it came out great. I deviated a bit by dropping to 325 and letting it go an hour and a half and it came out fantastic. I also added in some chopped bell pepper but otherwise kept to the ingredient list as shown. The brown sugar was a nice touch and drew compliments. I would recommend this recipe and will do again in the future. 06 of 1,037 Photo by  Connie Sanders 04/04/2024 OK with tweaks This recipe was easy, and I really like the sauce on top. However, it would be easier to make with more specific quantities of onion, salt, and pepper. This is not a recipe in which one can sample to test for the amount of salt. Onions come in different sizes, and I ended up using 1/2 of a large onion, which was plenty. Also, some pieces of the onion did not get completely softened. If I make this recipe again, I think I’ll sauté the onions a bit prior to adding them to the mixture. 07 of 1,037 Photo by  lauracrider9515 02/18/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite I always tweak recipes. For this one, I added about 1 cup total of diced carrots & zucchini, reducing the milk by about 1/8 cup. We like lots of flavor, so I also added Dan O's, Worcestershire sauce, Tapatio sauce and chili powder to the meat mixture. I poked finger size holes in the top after forming the loaf and dropped topping in. I also used dark brown sugar in the topping. So so so good! 08 of 1,037 Photo by  GutsySpam3341 01/27/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite Great recipe,thanks..We're from Philippines and this is a new recipe for us. I just modified the sauce, i didn't put mustard coz its not a staple condiments here 09 of 1,037 Photo by  WittyBeet3705 01/15/2024 I didn't have the bread crumbsSo had jalapeno pretzels I crushed up and made the one meatloafNext one used Cool ranch DoritosNext used regular DoritosNext used brown sugar oatmealLast one I had a bag of honey barbecue potato chips I crushed up and put in it.The glaze is different on each one also but basically ketchup honey mustard Worcestershire sauce Parmesan cheese. Last I glazed one with a very spicy halabanero based honey mustard.You may ask why I made five meatloafs found out my half a beef is coming sooner than I anticipated so had to come up with a creative use for all the ground beef I left over from the last beef. 10 of 1,037 Photo by  George Cuyjet 01/14/2024 Now this Meat Loaf is what I am used to! So easy to prepare. Moist, melt in your mouth, cut it with a fork. Used Ketchup and a hickory smoke BBQ sauce. I will make this again and again. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Air Fryer Meatloaf 72 Ratings Classic Meatloaf 664 Ratings Healthier Easy Meatloaf 18 Ratings Best Meatloaf 1,126 Ratings Melt-In-Your-Mouth Meatloaf 1,021 Ratings Meatloaf Muffins 164 Ratings Mini Meatloaf Ghosts 13 Ratings Brown Sugar Meatloaf with Ketchup Glaze 162 Ratings Instant Pot Meatloaf 70 Ratings The Most Easy and Delish Meatloaf EVER! 198 Ratings Best Ever Meatloaf with Brown Gravy 208 Ratings Low-Carb Bacon-Wrapped Meatloaf 1 Rating Best Ever Meat Loaf 1,236 Ratings Italian Mozzarella-Stuffed Meatloaf 12 Ratings Mary's Meatloaf 567 Ratings Garden Meatloaf 22 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Janet Shum
instructions: Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco;Combine ground beef, onion, milk, bread crumbs, and egg in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper. Transfer into prepared loaf pan. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco;Mix ketchup, brown sugar, and mustard together in a small bowl until well combined; pour over meatloaf and spread it evenly over the top. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco;Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco;Serve hot and enjoy! Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
